Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: The property is located in the large market town of Huddersfield, West Yorkshire. Ramsden Street sits off the traditional prime New Street and is used as one of the major thoroughfares to The Piazza Shopping Centre. Occupiers in the vicinity include Cancer Research and Betfred.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property comprises ground floor sales with ancillary space at basement, first and second floors.

Tenure
The property is held on a full repairing and insuring lease, which expires 11th November 2023.

Quoting Rent
£30,000 per annum exclusive.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £74,500.00 and the rates payable are £35,760.00 pa. The UBR for 2017/2018 is 48.00p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Castleford is located approximately 16 miles south east of Leeds and 10 miles north east of Wakefield. Principal road access into Castleford is via either the A655 or A656 both of which interlink with the M62 motorway approximately 2 miles to the south. 

The subject unit is located on a well let retail parade in Airedale, which forms part of Castleford's urban area, approximately 2 miles to the east of the town centre. The parade has a mix of local and national retailers including Tesco Express, Greggs and Co-op. Directly in front of the unit is car parking providing circa 26 spaces.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property occupies the ground floor of a two-storey semi-detached dwelling, comprising a large main sales area, staff accommodation, customer toilets and a yard at the rear.

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease expiring 30/12/2026.

Alternatively, the premises are available by way of a sub-lease.

Rent
The current passing rent is £14,000, exclusive of all other outgoings.

Rates
We understand from the VOA website that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £12,500 and the rates payable are £6,137.50 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 49.1p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Halifax is located 15 miles south west of Leeds, 7 miles south west of Bradford and 32 miles north east of Manchester. The town benefits being close in proximity to the A646 and A629, providing access to the M62 and thus the M1.


The property is located on King Edward Street, a retail street with occupiers in the vicinity including Halifax Bank and, The Yorkshire Linen Co. and Santander.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property is arranged over ground floor and basement. Ground floor provides the sales area while the basement offers storage space. There is a shared service yard to the rear.

Tenure
The property is available on a new effective full repairing and insuring sub-lease for length of term to be agreed.

Rent
The property is available at a rent of £10,000 per annum exclusive.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £9,400.00 and the rates payable are £4,512.00 pa. The UBR for 2018/2019 is 48.00p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: - 56 ft Briggate frontage, 31 ft Headrow frontage
- Flexibility on demise (first floor can be included if required)

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Leeds is the economic capital of Yorkshire and the North East with a total population of 792,525.

The subject property occupies a prime corner position at the junction of Briggate and Headrow. Briggate is Leeds' principal pedestrianised retail sreet where anchor tenants include Harvey Nichols, Zara and Marks and Spencer's.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The property is arranged over ground floor, basement and first floor. The ground floor provides full height glazing and benefits from the prominent return frontage on to The Headrow.

The basement currently provides storage space but could be utilised for sales or seating. The first floor can be made available to suit specific occupier requirements.

The premises are available either on the basis of the ground floor and basement only, or the first floor can also be included.

Tenure
This property is available by way of a new lease with terms to be agreed.

Rent
Further information is available upon application.

Terms
This property is available by way of a new lease with terms to be agreed.

Rates
The premises are currently subject to an outstanding rates appeal. Further information is available upon request.

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Leeds benefits from a population of circa 809,000 and sits approximately 45 miles north east of Manchester and 40 miles north of Sheffield. 



The property is located on Boar Lane which forms part of the retail and leisure circuit at the southern part of Leeds city centre. Opposite the property is the entrance to The Trinity Centre which is Leeds main shopping destination, boasting footfall of 23 million per annum. The unit also benefits from being close to Leeds train station and a number of bus stops. National retailers in the vicinity include Urban Outfitters, Up & Running and Greggs.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The unit provides a ground floor sales area with ancillary storage to the rear.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £ and the rates payable are £ pa. The UBR for 2021/2022 is p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Leeds is the principal retail and commercial centre in the North East of England. By road, the city is strategically close to the M1, A1(M) and M62, providing convenient access to the nation’s motorway network. 

The subject property is located on Duncan Street, a short distance from Boar Lane, Briggate and The Trinity Shopping Centre, all of which form Leeds retail provision. Duncan Street, along with Lower Briggate and Call Lane act as the entertainment sector in the city.

National retailers in the immediate vicinity include Five Guys, Pie Minister, Nando's and Yorkshire Building Society.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The premises occupy ground floor comprising a main sales area, customer toilets, staff accommodation and storage space.

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease expiring 24/12/2026, with the option to break on 24/12/2021.

Alternatively, the premises are available by way of a sub-lease.

Rent
The current passing rent is £50,000, exclusive of all other outgoings.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £57,000.00 and the rates payable are £29,184.00 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 51.20p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
The location provides a fantastic opportunity to provide a gym for the surrounding office occupiers with Pinsent Masons, Gilbanks, Barclays, NM Rothschild, Ahead Partnership, Spaces and FFP Design situated within the same building, together with HSBC, NatWest, Santander and the University of Law on Park Row.



With Nearby competitive socialising operators such as Junkyard Golf Club, Tick Tock Unlock and Roxy's Ball Room thriving in Leeds city centre, this basement space provides a unique opportunity for an occupier to make it their own, offering socialising games/performances for the surrounding leisure circuit.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
FANTASTIC & UNIQUE GYM/LEISURE OPPORTUNITY 

C.6,690 sq ft GIA (with potential to extend to c.9,506 sq ft if required subject to maximum capacity)

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Bradford is located in West Yorkshire approximately 9 miles west of Leeds, 35 miles north-east of Manchester and 12 miles north of Huddersfield. Bradford benefits from excellent road communications with the M606 motorway leading directly to the M62 motorway.

The subject property occupies a position on Bank Street, which is the principle retail provision in the city along with Kirkgate and Darley Street. The new 550,000 sq ft Broadway Shopping Centre is within the immediate vicinity and provides an estimated 1295 car parking spaces, enhancing the retail offering. National retailers in the vicinity include Ladbrokes, HSBC, Greggs and Yorkshire Building Society.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The premises occupy a ground floor unit forming part of Broadway House, comprising a main sales area, customer toilets, staff accommodation and storage space.

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease expiring 28/05/2032, with the option to break on 28/05/2022.

Alternatively, the premises are available by way of a sub-lease.

Rent
The current passing rent is £20,000, exclusive of all other outgoings.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £25,250.00 and the rates payable are £12,397.75 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 49.10p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: Forms part of The Core Shopping Centre

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: The property is located in a prominent position, fronting the busy pedestrianised retail parade Lands Lane, in the heart of Leeds City Centre. The unit also forms part of ‘The Core’ retail and leisure scheme and sits adjacent to HMV. Other nearby major occupiers include Levi’s, Foot Asylum, Card Factory and Byron. Costa and Ask are due to open on Lands Lane in summer 2018.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The premises benefit from trading levels at both ground and first floor, with further storage accommodation located in the basement.  The unit benefits from dual frontages to both Lands Lane and the internal mall of The Core Shopping Centre.

Tenure
The property is occupied under an existing lease which expires 23rd June 2024.

Rent
Rent Upon Application

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £226,000.00 and the rates payable are £111,418.00 pa. The UBR for 2018/2019 is 49.30p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
Leeds is the principal retail and commercial centre in the North East of England. By road, the city is strategically close to the M1, A1(M) and M62, providing convenient access to the nation’s motorway network. 

The subject property occupies a position on The Headrow, directly opposite Leeds Town Hall. There are several buss loops directly outside of the property providing access to the peripheral areas of Leeds. National occupiers in the vicinity include Superdrug, Browns, TSB Bank and Cafe Nero.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
The premises occupy ground floor comprising a main sale area, customer toilets, staff accommodation and storage space.

Tenure
The premises are available by way of an assignment of the existing lease expiring 24/12/2023.

Alternatively, the premises are available by way of a sub-lease.

Rent
The current passing rent is £25,400, exclusive of all other outgoings.

Rates
We are verbally informed by the Local Rating Authority that the current Rateable Value of the shop is £30,250.00 and the rates payable are £15,094.75 pa. The UBR for 2019/2020 is 49.90p. Interested parties are advised to make their own enquiries with the Local Authority for verification purposes

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text: Leeds is the principal commercial and financial centre for Yorkshire and a major city in the northwest. The city is located 44 miles north east of Manchester, 24 miles southwest of York and 33 miles north of Sheffield. The city benefits from excellent road communications with the M1, A1(m) and M62 connecting the city with the wider national motorway network and providing direct roads to London to the south, Manchester and Liverpool to the west and Newcastle upon Tyne in the north. Regular rail services operate between Leeds Station to London Kings Cross, Edinburgh and York in approximate journey times of 2 hours 11 minutes, 3 hours 10 minutes and 25 minutes respectively. The Site is located 1.2 miles from Leeds City Centre and 0.6 miles from the University of Leeds and Leeds Beckett University respectively.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: The broadly rectangular site extends to 0.85 acres (0.34 hectares) and comprises a two-storey brick and stone rendered building that adjoins Sugarwell Court, fronting Meanwood Road. A double height corrugated warehousing unit providing c.20,000 sq. of accommodation is located to the rear. The site has a single point of access/egress onto Meanwood Road. The site is currently occupied by an insulation distributor and manufacturer and is therefore currently used for employment purposes.
